headline: Russian Mushroom and Potato Soup
description: I make this soup every Halloween and is the 'signal' to the family that the cool weather has arrived. I've been making it for 15 years now and out of all the soups I make, it is still everyone's favorite. Enjoy!
name: Russian Mushroom and Potato Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 sprig fresh dill weed, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Mix in leeks and carrots, and cook 5 minutes. Pour in broth. Season with dill, salt, pepper, and bay leaf. Mix in potatoes, cover, and cook 20 minutes, or until potatoes are tender but firm. Remove and discard the bay leaf.
Melt the remaining butter in a skillet over medium heat, and saute the mushrooms 5 minutes, until lightly browned. Stir into the soup.
In a small bowl, mix the half-and-half and flour until smooth. Stir into the soup to thicken. Garnish each bowl of soup with fresh dill to serve.

review.reviewBody: Great recipe! I used truffle salt since they go with the mushrooms. Also added italian seasoning, garlic powder, and oregano as suggested in another review. Definitely, a keeper!
One of my favorites!

The only change to the recipe was to use vegetable broth instead of chicken and to sautee the mushrooms first before adding the carrots and leek. I don't see the need to dirty another pan when it can easily be a one pot meal. Served with bread sticks
Very good and easy recipe. I did add an onion. It is a little on the bland side so season it if you want to.
A huge hit! Used two 12 oz pkg of mushrooms and a pint of cream. Everyone oohed and aahed and loved! Get why this is the submitters fall favorite! Would absolutely make again! Thank you!!

Definitely 5 stars. I made a couple adjustments. I partially precooked the spuds. I didn't want to reduce the broth too much. And I was trying to use up some whipping cream so substituted for half & half. It was delicious. I've already shared the recipe.
Excellent soup. Added celery, carrots and onions. Garlic, oregano, Italian seasoning. Plus one can of cream of potato soup and thickened with half and half/flour mixture.
I used half cream and half milk to cut the calories a bit. But a great dish for a cold day
I absolutely loved this soup. SO yummy!!

I made this the first time as is and found it to be OK, a bit more American (kind of bland) than the eastern European soups I grew up with. The mushroom taste wasn't strong enough and it was missing a certain kvas (sourness/tanginess). So the second time I added 2 packets (total 2oz.) of dried mushrooms (porcini) and restricted some of the cooking liquid so I could add some pickle juice at the end but lemon/sauerkraut juice/cider vinegar/citric acid would probably work ok too. It's funny how little seasoning decisions transform a dish culturally.

This is an awesome soup! With 900+ five star reviews it's pretty hard to go wrong. I cut the recipe in half as my wife hates Mushrooms, therefore I rarely make anything with them in a recipe. This one was all for me!
I only had russet potatoes so I cut the time to 15 minutes so they'd hold together. I only had onions and no leeks so that was a substitute. 
The big change I made was to use Better than Bullion roast beef soup base. So much better flavor than boxed soup broth and cheaper! One little jar makes 9.5 quarts of broth! Under $4 at Walmart.
I did follow one suggestion from another reviewer who skipped the flour and half and half thickener and I used about 1/3C of sour cream. Just be sure to temper it before you stir it in so it won't curdle.
It is Mushroom Nirvana!
Great recipe. Made as written. Delicious.
It was delicious! I also thought that it was a lot of dried dill. It works so well tho. I will make this again.

Really great soup, lighter with olive oil, butter does make it a filling taste.

Made it again and this time added to the carrots, a little asparagus, celery, and zucchini.

Paired it with a slice of brie cheese and grilled toast.
Amazing soup . I didnâ€™t have leaks so I added chopped celery and chopped onion in its place . It was so good . Even my kids liked it .
Awesome recipe and VERY simple to do. Only thing I did was use a hand blender to make it creamy. The combo of potatoes and mushrooms blended was incredible and a meal in itself.
I love this recipe. the combination of flavors is genius. I made it exactly as is.
Very tasty, but I will decrease the salt and the butter next time.

Love this mushroom soup, and I'm on the hunt for the best mushroom soups out there, made it twice and second time I added a lot more leeks. That I think it made it more peppery or spicy? Not sure but I'm guessing that's what did it, so kids and wife said it was to peppery. Stick to the recipe as I did the first time around and it's awesome a definite keeper if you love mushroom soups!!!
Not very much flavor but I used onions instead and didnâ€™t have dill weed.

A great combo of a potato soup and mushroom soup. Ended up reminding me of a chowder. The dill makes it special. Wasnâ€™t flavorful enough for me so I added crushed garlic when sautÃ©ing the veggies more pepper and crushed red pepper and Even a dash of curry powder. Tasty. A good base soup to play with further. Recommend trying it; itâ€™s worth a go.
Love it! The only thing I did different was to use beef broth instead of chicken broth. AWESOME!
Wonderful soup!
I did like this soup, although it was too salty. That's easy to adjust, but I am unlikely to make this recipe again as there are similar recipes I prefer.

Made this soup years ago and forgot about it until I came across it a few days ago and read my notes about how good it was! Since I had all the ingredients, I made it last night . It was wonderful---hearty and so flavorful. We won't forget about it again!

This was so simple, but had amazing flavor. For the mushrooms, I used 1/2 LB of cremini and 1/2 lb of Portobello. The mushrooms and Leeks are everything. My Husband later came along and added sausage, which was good too, but it really didn't need it. Fed it to my kids and gave some to my neighbors. Everyone Raved about it! Will Definitely make this again! Perfect Fall Soup!

Oh my goodness this soup is delicious! I had some frozen leeks from my spring garden, and this was the perfect use for them. I threw in a sprig of rosemary, because it was there, but otherwise kept it the same. My entire family loved it, and so it will be a regular in our winter stew rotation.

This soup was phenomenal! I kept the recipe the same except for the addition of smoked turkey sausage. It paired well with the ingredients. This was a big hit at my house and I plan to keep this recipe in the rotation for winter soups!

Absolutely delicious soup! I substituted onion for the leeks, and used the blender to thicken the soup. I kept half the mushrooms sliced and added them back in. Thanks for sharing this recipe. I will make this again and again!
Really love to make this recipe once in a while. Different, tasty, gotta love mushrooms and the dill just brings it all home! Done as is. Thanks for the great recipe!
The perfect Fall soup. So good!! I added a little garlic powder and then used a hand blender to emulsify it a bit. So velvety and savory. Will definitely make this again and again.

Wow! This was really good! Easy as well! I had to sub reg. onions for the leaks and heavy whipping cream for the half and half plus flour. (I just used what I had on hand). This probably may have been thicker if I used the flour with the cream, but it was perfect w/o! Thank you for sharing!!

The only changes I made were to omit the salt (broth is salty enough), doubled the mushrooms and used baby carrots instead of sliced. It's ridiculously delicious for the ingredients it uses. Definitely will make again. With no description of what mushrooms or potatoes were preferred, I used portabella and white mushrooms and russet potatoes. It took much longer for the potatoes to become tender than indicated in the recipe, though I cut them quite small. None of these detracts from my five-star rearing.

I just made this soup. I had most of the ingredients in the house, but just had to substitute half dried mushrooms, reconstituted, chopped and sautÃ©ed with the fresh. I used fresh dill â€” about 2-3 tablespoons. I thought it was excellent. Had it for late breakfast. Donâ€™t wait until fall. Or dinner.

So tasty and easy to make! I, like others, used less half & half and butter & instead purÃ©ed some of the potatoes to make it creamy. I also went a little overboard on the dill, which I love, and it was GREAT!! Thanks for a great soup recipe!
Deliciosa
Love this soup! This time I made the broth from a rotisserie chicken carcass and added in the meat at the end.
One of my favorite recipes, I make it as written all the time. If I donâ€™t have half and half, I use milk, cream of mushroom soup, or even just extra flour and water. Itâ€™s a flexible recipe
A little work , but worth it. A winmet in our house.
We did not like this, lacked depth of flavor. We had to add a lot of additional herbs to make it edible.

Fabulous! Thank you so much for sharing this! We have visited Poland 10 times in the past 10 years and spent much time there. We have even picked the wild mushrooms. This soup brought back our wonderful memories since we can't be there right now. It is exactly as we remember it. So delicious and so different. Nothing needs to be changed at all, other than using more dill.
Amazing soup the only change I do is to cook the flour in the buttered mushrooms and add half and half to that. Enjoy very tasty soup.
My wife loves this soup, especially during cold weather. It's hearty and incredibly tasty!
The husband's comment "ooh, that was good". Emphasis on "good".

We truly enjoyed this recipe. My husband particularly liked it. Tried it because we got tired of chicken broth based soup so it was really good for a change and we ate it for dinner one night and lunch the next day. Delicious, thank you.
Absolutely amazing! This is my new go-to for comfort soup.
My favourite potato soup. Mmmmmmm
It was a lovely soup. Would make again.
My family thought this soup was delicious and I did as well. Easy ingredients and directions...Would love to see more ethnic soups.
Just added a few more spices and extra salt. A little bland for my families taste. Otherwise very good.

Iâ€™ve made this twice. Once, following the recipe, exactly and once with the following changes; before adding the dairy, I removed 1\2 of the mushrooms and potatoâ€™s and used the hand blender in the rest of the soup. I did this to check if it would thicken without the additions. It did, so I added the reserved mushrooms and potatoâ€™s back into the soup and did not add 1/2 & 1/2. I garnished each bowl with a dollop of sour cream and fresh snipped dill. I would always use leeks as they are very nutritious and the leek flavor is important, in my opinion. If I wanted to thicken the soup further, I would use my â€˜go tooâ€™ method; kneed flour into a tbls or so, of butter until well incorporated, then add to the soup and simmer on low. It will thicken beautifully. So...the original recipe is still a 5 star!

Made this for a small group of friends for Imbolc. I halved it because there were only 6 of us. That's a mistake I won't make again! LOL Everyone loved it, including the two guest who usually aren't too keen on mushrooms and the 11 month old who's semi picky. Will definitely make again, but the whole recipe this time. Also, I didn't have fresh dill, but added a bit extra of the dried and that seemed to work just fine. I will absolutely make again for company. Might make a batch this weekend to freeze and see how it does.
I made half the batch since others in my house don't like mushrooms. Was a delicious lunch!! I only changed heavy whipping cream for the half & half since that's what I had on hand.

Pretty much an instant addition to my favorites from the moment I tried it. Really easy to make, and super hearty and flavorful- definitely makes the cold winter day a little bit more bearable! Potatoes and carrots cooked to the perfect consistency. Get a slice of crusty bread to dip straight into the soup and you're all good to go!

This was absolutely fantastic. I halved the recipe since were 3 of us eating it for dinner but did not change the ingredients except adding a little more butter to saute the mushrooms since half the butter wasn't enough. The major change I made was to use an immersion blender at the very end after almost finishing the thickening so I could make a "creamed" soup. I used the blender until it was a medium-fine puree with little bits of the ingredients vs completely pureed. Then put it back on the burner on med-low until it completely thickened. It was AMAZING. My somewhat picky daugher loved it and my husband had 2 1/2 bowls of it. Will absolutely repeat it - one of the rare recipes where no tweaks are needed, even the salt levels which are normally horribly high to me.
Unique, easy and delicious. Just added a pinch of cayenne for some zip.

I love it when people rate a recipe and make minor changes to it! Itâ€™s one of my favourite things about this site.
I didnâ€™t have have enough half & half, so I added a dollop if sour cream to serve. Delish!

I love it when people rate a recipe and make minor changes to it! Itâ€™s one of my favourite things about this site.
I didnâ€™t have have enough half & half, so I added a dollop if sour cream to serve. Delish!
We love this soup.

This is delicious - the photo is my second helping!! My husband loved it too. I used a regular onion, my immersion blender but left chunks, and added Colby jack cheese as garnish. My husband always adds pepper.
Used onions instead of leeks. Added 4 strips of thick bacon, cooked and crumbled, at the end.
Fabulous recipe, thank you for sharingâ€”forgot leeks and substituted an onion. Perfect consistency. The dill is critical to the flavor. Nice work!

Delicious! I didn't have any dill so added 1 tsp dried rosemary and 1 tsp basil instead(as those are supposed to be good substitutes). Next time, I might reduce the salt by 1/2 tsp, as I felt it was maybe just a tad too salty....but it didn't keep us from enjoying :)

I followed the recipe exactly and loved it. It was just right for our snowy day. Delicious! Was concerned with the amount of dill but was brave and put it in. It didnt overpower the soup at all. Taste is great.

I really love the flavor of this soup. I was nervous about all the dill, but itâ€™s just right and not overpowering in any way. I used Better than Bullion for broth and salt free butter. I made the rest as instructed. The only change Iâ€™d make next time is to sautÃ© the mushrooms a bit longer or maybe try a different variety; mine seemed a little gummy yet. But thatâ€™s the chef not the recipe! Iâ€™ll definitely be making this again!!

This was amazing, and really easy to make, even for someone like me who doesn't do a whole lot of cooking due to back and knee pain. Just chopped up all the ingredients beforehand, took a small break and then started actually cooking. I made it a bit salty because I accidentally used too much chicken buillon but it still turned out wonderfully! I'll definitely make this again.
This is a wonderful soup! I will make this again! Very satisfying! Added more dill, more half and half, a spoon of chicken base.
The best mushroom stew
absolutely my favorite soup todate. the whole family loved it. will definitely be making again
It was fair. Not something I'll make very often.
Delicious recipe. I did add garlic and almost tripled the dill since we love dill. I used mushroom broth and it all was tasty. Will make again with these modifications.
Fabulous soup@

I was looking for something to make with the limited ingredients I had on hand after coming home from a week out of town. Found this recipe and it was a perfect comforting welcome home soup for the family. The only thing I didnâ€™t have were leeks so sautÃ©ed onions instead. Iâ€™m sure leeks would make it even that much better. This soup will definitely become part of our family!

Made as directed except for a couple of small changes. Used less salt because I added a little salt to the onions as I was sautÃ©ing them to sweat them. I didnâ€™t have any cream or half-and-half so used regular milk and a dollop of sour cream. It was delicious as is and this is my second time making it. This time I added some pork roast that needed to be used. I chopped into small cubes and sautÃ©ed first and then re-added towards the end. The soup and pork flavors really complimented each other and it was just as delicious the next day for lunch.

My mother and I made this together on a cold, rainy, icy, and snowy March day. We liked the recipe as is, but what really put it over the top is a teaspoon of dried tarragon and a teaspoon of mexican oregano. Then, it was perfect. Served with toasted rye bread on the side.

This is an extremely good soup. I sautÃ©ed my mushrooms first, then set to the side and then the leeks. I didnâ€™t want to lose the flavor by sautÃ©ing them in a separate pan. Also later when itâ€™s time to add the mushrooms back in, I let it cook for a bit to let the flavors come together. This also helped the potatoes break brown
LOVE IT! I didn't think I'd like the fill, but it was dillicious! Haha.

Wow. An amazing soup! And when I hesitated to put in two teaspoons of salt I checked the reviews for tweaks and found three separate reviews all saying not to tweak anything!! I never hear that about a recipe! So that alone made me pretty confident this recipe would be a keeper.
Excellent soup I used onion instead of leek and only 1 teaspoon of dill will definitely make it again
A good recipe, but the amount of cream makes this much sweeter than I wanted it to be. I'll have to add more chicken stock and spices to cut back the sweetness.

Excellent Soup. I served it with homemade french bread. We had guests from out of town and they raved. I only used about half the half & half and flour. I did not decrease the butter at all, and I added some garlic powder and onion powder to taste while potatoes cooked. Just enough to compliment the dill not over power. Thank you for this recipe, this is definitely a permanent winter addition in our house.
I made it, instead of 1/2 and 1/2 cream I used sour cream with flour. Didn't put dill in it. It was good
I followed the directions,except added 1 TBS of minced Garlic.
Really awesome; even my most skeptical child had 2nds.
Used hand emulsifier to blend half the soup. No flour needed. Fantastic.
This is a new family favorite!!

I loved the flavor and simple ingredients. I'm giving it 4 stars only because 5 tablespoons of butter made the soup a little greasy for my taste. Otherwise, it would be 5 stars. I didn't have leeks so used yellow onion. Some of the comments said the soup was salty. I used low sodium or unsalted broth.
This recipe is very unique in flavor and fairly strong! I would change nothing with the recipe and I think this soup pairs well with bread like Italian bread.

Really tasty soup. I halved the recipe (except the butter), decided to use lactose free whole milk instead of 1/2 and 1/2 and fresh dill for the whole thing and it still came out great. I used a low sodium chicken broth so I could control the salt intake. Itâ€™s probable that Iâ€™m going to make this for the rest of my life.
Absolutely delicious soup! Great mushroom flavor, even though all I had was a can of mushrooms. Will definitely add this recipe to my soup repertoire!
Delicious! Served to 7 adults and each one loved it!

Great, hardy meal soup!! I did make a couple of changes since I made this for my sick brother and he's not supposed to have dairy. I took out about a quarter of the soup with a little broth and put it in a blender and then put it back to thicken the soup(instead of using heavy cream and flour). I also added some garlic powder and complete seasoning to the veggies because I must add those to everything I cook. The soup is delicious. I will add bacon and a little cheese and sour cream because I can!! Thanks for the great recipe!
I printed this out, made it, and passed the recipe to a family member, who ALSO made it! Both of us were successful and this is the best soup ever! I NEVER...purchase canned soup anymore!
I thought it was a very easy recipe -- nice consistency and tasty... although I was minus the leeks and pepper, I added broccoli . Will make again.

This is now one of our favorite soups. Yum! Thanks for sharing!
Question: Does anyone know if this soup can be frozen and used at a later date? I was going to make a big batch for the holidays and freeze it, but a little concerned about the mushrooms being okay. Anyone tried it? If so, how did it turn out?
Thanks.
Delicious! I added half a cup of instant mashed potato flakes to thicken it up.
Wow, definitely loved this soup!!! My boyfriend and his family are Russian and they loved it too!!!
I followed the directions to the letter, with the exception of using kale vs spinach. It was delicious and got double thumbs up from my family. Easy recipe and I will make it again...and again.

5 stars!!! Only sub was diced onion for leek and I added a bit of garlic. I was nervous about the amount of dill, but it was spot on. The half and half / broth mix was perfect. I will be making this again and often. Thank you!
